algorithm_technique: Prefix sums to map random numbers to rectangles, binary search for efficient selection.
problem_summary_simple: Pick a random integer point uniformly from a set of non-overlapping rectangles.
problem_summary_technical: Uses prefix sums of rectangle areas to select a rectangle, then binary search to pick a point within it.
key_insights: The core idea is to treat the total area as a single large range and map a random number to a specific rectangle based on its area.
Prefix sums are crucial for efficiently determining which rectangle a random number falls into.
Binary search (bisect_right) is used to find the index of the chosen rectangle in the prefix sum array.
